message.content:
Below is one way to “decode” what is shown in the two reference images and then match and order the exact blocks from the dictionary (without re‐orienting them).  I have divided the explanation into the three requested parts.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1) DESCRIPTION OF THE MAIN (TARGET) IMAGE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

The scene actually contains two separate upright structures:

A)  TALL “WINDOW” TOWER (on the left in the image)  
   •  Layers & Block Count:  
      –  Bottom Layer has a short green rectangular block on the ground (the base) with a tall orange cylinder standing on it.  
      –  Around the cylinder (roughly in the middle) is a rectangular “window‐frame” made of four blocks: two vertical green bars on the left/right and two horizontal yellow bars across the top/bottom.  
      –  Inside that rectangular frame is a single orange triangular prism.  
      –  Above the frame rests another short green rectangular block, then a small blue block perched on top.  
      –  In total, this tower uses nine blocks.  

   •  Spatial Relationships:  
      –  The green base block sits at floor level; the orange cylinder sits squarely atop it.  
      –  The four “frame” blocks form a ring around the mid‐height of the cylinder: two tall greens on the left/right, and two flat yellows top/bottom.  
      –  The orange triangular prism is tucked inside that ring, leaning inward.  
      –  Finally, another green block sits on top of the cylinder (above the frame), with the small blue block stacked on the very top.  

B)  “ROCKET” TOWER (on the right in the image)  
   •  Layers & Block Count:  
      –  At floor level are four orange triangular prisms arranged around a central orange cylinder (all touching the cylinder at its base).  
      –  Just above those triangles is a ring of four small blue rectangular blocks encircling the cylinder.  
      –  Capping the cylinder at the top is an orange triangular prism (like a roof).  
      –  In total, this rocket uses ten blocks.  

   •  Spatial Relationships:  
      –  The four orange triangular blocks all stand around the bottom cylinder, apexes pointing outward; they form a sort of “skirt.”  
      –  The blue rectangular ring is placed above those triangles, hugging the cylinder.  
      –  Finally, the orange triangular “cap” sits on top of the now‐exposed top of the cylinder.  

Overall Count: 9 blocks in the left tower + 10 blocks in the right “rocket” = 19 blocks.


────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2) SELECTING THE REQUIRED BLOCKS FROM THE DICTIONARY
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

Below is a possible matching of each visible piece to a dictionary index.  
(The same index is re‐used when multiples of that shape/orientation occur.)

A)  Left “Window” Tower (9 total):
   1)  Green base block → index 4  (short green rectangular block, horizontal)  
   2)  Orange cylinder → index 9   (vertical orange cylinder)  
   3)  Vertical green bars (2×) → index 5 (used twice for the tall green blocks left/right)  
   4)  Horizontal yellow bars (2×) → index 7 (used twice for the flat yellow blocks top/bottom)  
   5)  Orange triangular prism (inside frame) → for example index 15 (or whichever one has the apex facing forward in exactly that orientation)  
   6)  Green block on top → index 4 again (same short horizontal green shape as the base)  
   7)  Small blue top block → index 1 (a small blue rectangular block placed “upright”)  

B)  Right “Rocket” Tower (10 total):
   1)  Cylinder in the middle → index 9  (vertical orange cylinder again)  
   2)  Four orange triangular prisms at the base → indices 13, 14, 15, and 16 (one for each rotated orientation around the cylinder, apexes outward)  
   3)  Four small blue blocks forming the ring → index 1 repeated four times (the same small blue block used in a way that its unrotated orientation still works for each side)  
   4)  Orange triangular prism cap on top → index 12 (or whichever dictionary triangular roof‐shape sits with its apex “straight up”)  

Hence the complete “shopping list” by index is:

•  Index 1:  five uses total (1 for the tall tower top, plus 4 for the rocket’s ring)  
•  Index 4:  two uses (bottom and top of the left tower)  
•  Index 5:  two uses (the left and right bars of the tower window)  
•  Index 7:  two uses (the top and bottom bars of the tower window)  
•  Index 9:  two uses (the main cylinder of each structure)  
•  Index 12: one use (rocket’s top prism)  
•  Index 13: one use (one of the base triangles of the rocket)  
•  Index 14: one use (one of the base triangles of the rocket)  
•  Index 15: two uses (one inside the tower frame, one of the rocket base triangles)  
•  Index 16: one use (one rocket base triangle)  


────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3) STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY INSTRUCTIONS
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

Below is one logical order.  You can of course vary the sequence somewhat, so long as lower pieces go first.

{
  Step1:  Move block with index 4    (place the green base of the left tower)
  Step2:  Move block with index 9    (place the orange cylinder on that base)
  Step3:  Move block with index 5    (add a vertical green bar on one side of the cylinder)
  Step4:  Move block with index 5    (add the second vertical green bar on the other side)
  Step5:  Move block with index 7    (place a horizontal yellow bar for the lower part of the “window” frame)
  Step6:  Move block with index 7    (place the other horizontal yellow bar for the top of the “window” frame)
  Step7:  Move block with index 15   (insert the orange triangular prism inside that frame)
  Step8:  Move block with index 4    (put another green block on top of the cylinder)
  Step9:  Move block with index 1    (cap the left tower with the small blue block)

  Step10: Move block with index 13   (start rocket base: first triangular prism)
  Step11: Move block with index 14   (second triangular prism around the cylinder base)
  Step12: Move block with index 15   (third triangular prism around the cylinder base)
  Step13: Move block with index 16   (fourth triangular prism around the cylinder base)
  Step14: Move block with index 9    (place the central orange cylinder for the rocket)
  Step15: Move block with index 1    (first small blue block forming the ring around the rocket cylinder)
  Step16: Move block with index 1    (second small blue block for that ring)
  Step17: Move block with index 1    (third small blue block for that ring)
  Step18: Move block with index 1    (fourth small blue block for that ring)
  Step19: Move block with index 12   (top off the rocket with the final orange triangular prism)
}

That completes the construction exactly as shown, using only the blocks (and each block’s orientation) given in the dictionary.
